intro: Cyclodium guianense, commonly known as the Guianese cyclodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Guyana, Suriname, and French Guiana. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves, which are often lobed and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is typically found in moist, tropical environments. Cyclodium guianense is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
